place.name: ST EDRENS
place.gazetteerText: EDRENS (St.), a parish in Haverfordwest district, Pembroke; 9 miles NNW of Haverfordwest r. station, and 10 E by N of St. Davids. Post town, Letterstone, under Haverfordwest. Acres, 916. Real property, £667. Pop., 118. Houses, 20. The property is much subdivided. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of S-Davids. Value, £120. Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
